173.article_body: Ahead of Union Home Minister Amit Shah's visit to Bihar, BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "I've heard that Lalu Ji (RJD chief), Nitish Ji (Bihar CM) and Deputy CM Tejashwi Ji are sad that...Amit Shah is coming to Bihar." Furthermore, he asked, "Does the Home Minister now need to take a directive from them to go to Bihar?"

174.title: At least 1 dead as Mexico hit by 2nd powerful earthquake in a week
174.article_body: At least one person has been killed after a 6.8-magnitude earthquake struck western Mexico on Thursday. The woman died after she fell down the stairs of her home in Mexico City as quake alarms rang out and buildings began to shake, officials said. This comes three days after a 7.6-magnitude earthquake shook western and central Mexico, killing two people.

175.title: Fight breaks out between students in Ghaziabad, continues even after 2 get hit by car
175.article_body: A fight broke out on Wednesday afternoon between students of a Ghaziabad college, and continued despite two of them being struck by a speeding car. The police said several students have been detained after the incident. "The car was being driven by a student who lost control and could not apply brakes on time," said an official.

176.title: 106 PFI members arrested in raids by NIA, ED across 11 states
176.article_body: As many as 106 PFI members were arrested in raids jointly carried out by the NIA, the ED and police across 11 states. Over 1,500 law enforcement personnel were reportedly involved in the operation. Offices and residences of those allegedly involved in "funding terrorism, organising training camps and radicalising people to join proscribed organisations" were raided, reported ANI.

177.title: People look for drama anywhere: Olivia on Harry-Chris' spitting reports
177.article_body: Olivia Wilde has clarified that Harry Styles didn't spit on Chris Pine during the Venice premiere of 'Don't Worry Darling'. Wilde called it a "perfect example" of how people "look for drama anywhere they can". Her reaction has come days after a video went viral, in which fans claimed that Styles had spit on Chris Pine.

178.title: Pune is the flag bearer of Indian culture: Nirmala Sitharaman
178.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Wednesday inaugurated 'Bharat Vidya', an online platform of courses started by the Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute (BORI) in Pune. She said, "The contribution by...(BORI) for Pune and...rest of the country is significant." "Pune is the flag bearer of Indian culture and...by digitising the data of rare books and manuscripts is the next step," she added.

179.title: E-bike rental service approved in Pune, 5,000 vehicles to run on pilot basis
179.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has approved the implementation of electric bike rental service in the city on a pilot basis for one year. Around 5,000 e-bikes will be available during the pilot phase and citizens will be able to rent them at a rate of ₹4 per kilometre. The bikes would be available at 250 locations across the city.

180.title: Jaishankar compares India & China's economy, lists '3 big things that went wrong for us'
180.article_body: Comparing the economies of India and China in US, MEA S Jaishankar said, "There were three big things which went wrong for us; one was of course at the start, the Partition, the delay in exercising the nuclear option, and delay in economic reform." He added, "China grew in this period territorially. China exercised its nuclear option early in 1964."

181.title: 'The Kashmir Files' & 'Rocketry' should also be sent to Oscars: Madhavan
181.article_body: Actor-director R Madhavan said India should also consider sending 'Rocketry' and 'The Kashmir Files' to the Oscars. His reaction has come after Gujarati film 'Chhello Show' was announced as India's official entry to the upcoming 95th Academy Awards. "I'm starting a campaign for Rocketry," he said. On 'Chhello Show', Madhavan said he hopes the film wins and makes India proud.

182.title: You came using PM Modi's photo, backstabbed BJP: Fadnavis to Uddhav
182.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Thursday criticised former CM Uddhav Thackeray saying, "In 2019 polls, you [Thackeray] came [to power] by showing PM [Narendra] Modi's photo, backstabbed BJP and went with Congress and NCP." "[You] tried your best to finish me [but] could not…and won't be able to do it later," he added.

183.title: TCS mandates employees to work from office 3 times a week
183.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services has sent an email to its employees mandating them to work from the office three times a week. The email further stated that managers will create a roster, and adhering to the roster is mandatory. It also said, "Needless to mention, any non-compliance will be taken seriously, and administrative measures may be applied."

184.title: 26-yr-old woman dies by suicide over harassment by youth in UP
184.article_body: A 26-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide after being harassed by a youth and his two friends in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Wednesday. According to the woman's family, the accused used to harass her for marriage and it continued even after she got married. The accused had reportedly threatened to kill the woman's husband and mother-in-law for rejecting his proposal.

185.title: Stampede at Hyd's Gymkhana for Ind-Aus cricket match tickets; 4 injured
185.article_body: A stampede broke out at Hyderabad's Gymkhana Ground after a huge crowd gathered to get tickets for the upcoming India versus Australia match scheduled for 25th September at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. Four people were injured in the incident. People reportedly queued outside the ticket counter since 5 am to buy tickets. Police lathi-charged to control the situation.

186.title: Hungarian PM says EU's sanctions on Russia should be scrapped: Report
186.article_body: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán told his ruling party that European Union's sanctions against Russia should be scrapped, a report said. According to a news platform, Orbán said EU sanctions have driven up gas prices and inflation, and if these measures were to be scrapped, gas prices would drop by 50%. "Sanctions are hurting Europe more than Russia," Orbán reiterated.

187.title: Rahul Gandhi resumes 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', plants sapling at Aluva college
187.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday resumed 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kerala's Aluva by planting a sapling brought from Lakshadweep at the premises of the Union Christian College, Aluva. "Rahul Gandhi paid tribute at a mango tree planted by Bapu there in the year 1925," Congress tweeted. On the 15th day of the 'yatra', many people joined Gandhi.

188.title: Congress President election schedule released, result on Oct 19
188.article_body: Congress released the schedule for election of its party President on Thursday. The nominations can be filed between September 24 and 30, while the list of final candidates will be published on October 8. The date of polling, if needed, will be October 17. Counting of votes and declaration of the result will be done on October 19.

189.title: Around 500 trees uprooted in Pune in last 3 months claiming lives
189.article_body: Pune witnessed around 500 tree-fall incidents in past three months which led to many deaths and serious injuries, Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) environment department said. Unplanned pruning of trees and putting concrete around trunks are key reasons for increase in tree-fall incidents, an official said. While inspecting, the officials found that many old trees don't have strong bases.

190.title: Supreme Court reserves judgement in Karnataka hijab ban case
190.article_body: Supreme Court reserved its judgement after hearing petitions challenging Karnataka High Court's order upholding hijab ban in educational institutes. "For those who are believers, it's essential. For those who are not...it's not essential," the advocate representing Muslim appellants said. Hijab is only restricted in classrooms, Karnataka Advocate General Prabhuling Navadgi told SC on Wednesday.

191.title: Fee hike by 400 times 'falsehood': Allahabad University amid protests
191.article_body: Allahabad University Vice-Chancellor Sangita Srivastava said that the claim of a hike in fees by 400 times was a "falsehood". This comes amid ongoing protests by students against fee hike. "The fee per student annually for the past several decades was ₹975 which comes to ₹81 per month...fee has been enhanced to ₹4,151 per year- ₹333 per month," Srivastava added.

192.title: Ford India finalises severance package for Chennai plant workers
192.article_body: Ford India, a subsidiary of US-based carmaker Ford, arrived at a final severance package for the workers of its Chennai plant after it decided to shut the plant down as part of a restructuring exercise. A cumulative severance package for each employee would range from ₹34.50 lakh-₹86.50 lakh and revised settlement would be an average of about 5.1 years' salary.

193.title: Ukraine calls for Russia to be stripped of veto rights at UNSC
193.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged the UN to impose "just punishment" on Russia and strip it of its UN Security Council (UNSC) veto power. Russia is a permanent UNSC member along with US, France, Britain and China. The UNSC meeting comes a day after Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered mobilisation of hundreds of thousands of troops to fight in Ukraine.

194.title: Ashneer shares pic with Kohli, says 'Delhi boys with common passion for 'Ben Stokes''
194.article_body: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover on Wednesday shared a picture with Virat Kohli and wrote, "What could the Delhi boys with a common passion for 'Ben Stokes' be discussing?" "All the best Virat Kohli for the match in Nagpur," he tweeted. The second T20I between India and Australia will be played in Nagpur tomorrow.

195.title: UP Assembly reserves today for women MLAs to raise their issues
195.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Assembly has reserved Thursday, September 22, for women MLAs to raise their issues, a step that Speaker Satish Mahana said no other legislative Assembly in the country has taken so far. There are 47 women MLAs in the 403-member UP Legislative Assembly and out of which 22 are first-timers.

196.title: Efforts on to change country's history: West Bengal CM Mamata
196.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday inaugurated the Alipore Independence Museum and said that the state has played an important role in country's struggle for independence. However, without naming anyone, Banerjee alleged that the country's history is being "changed" so that the future generation remains unaware. She added that it's the TMC government which is trying to "save" history.

197.title: SpiceJet pilots to get 20% pay hike, days after 80 of them sent on unpaid leave
197.article_body: SpiceJet will give a 20% salary hike to its pilots in October this year. This comes days after the airline sent 80 pilots on 3-month unpaid leave as a temporary measure to rationalise costs. As a part of the Emergency Credit Line Guarantee Scheme, SpiceJet has reportedly received the first tranche of payment and the second tranche is expected soon.

198.title: Class 1 girl gets locked up in school for 18 hours in UP's Sambhal
198.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was left locked behind in a school for about 18 hours in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district. The girl's relatives went looking for her but the school staff told her grandmother that no children were left there. The girl, a Class 1 student, was found only after the school reopened the next morning on Wednesday.

199.title: PFI workers protest in Kerala, K'taka, Tamil Nadu after NIA raids
199.article_body: The workers of Popular Front of India (PFI) took to the streets in Kerala, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu after the NIA raided its offices and leaders' residences across the country on Thursday. The agency raided multiple locations in about 10 states and arrested over 100 PFI members. The workers raised slogans against the central government and its investigating agencies.

200.title: Land worth ₹70 cr cleared in Greater Noida in anti-encroachment drive
200.article_body: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) on Wednesday cleared about 35,000 square meters of land worth ₹70 crore in an anti-encroachment drive in Sunpura. "Five JCBs were operated for about one-and-a-half hours," an official said. "An elimination squad has been formed to stop illegal occupation...GNIDA has deployed retired Army personnel...at its own expense," GNIDA CEO said.

201.title: Delhi government cuts school exam budget to ₹90 per student
201.article_body: The Delhi government has cut down the budget for conducting exams at government schools from ₹125 to ₹90 per student from Class 1 to Class 11 for 2022-23, the Directorate of Education (DoE) said in a circular. The DoE cited "shortage of budget" as reason behind the price deduction. "Demand of additional budget will not be entertained," the circular added.

202.title: Over 1,300 arrested at anti-mobilisation protests in Russia
202.article_body: Protests were held in several cities in Russia on Wednesday against President Vladimir Putin's announcement of a partial mobilisation of reservists to fight in Ukraine. Over 1,300 people were arrested at anti-mobilisation rallies in 38 cities, including Moscow, Russian protest monitoring group OVD-Info said. Meanwhile, most flights out of Russia were sold out after Putin's announcement.

203.title: Russians google 'How to leave Russia', 'How to break arm at home' amid mobilisation call
203.article_body: Google search trends in Russia showed a spike in queries like "how to leave Russia" and "how to break an arm at home" ahead of President Vladimir Putin's address on Wednesday in which he was likely to announce "martial law" and "mobilisation". Putin ordered country's first mobilisation since World War II, warning that he is not bluffing about nuclear attack.

204.title: Pune civic body to use automated vehicles to catch stray animals
204.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to use automated vehicles with hydraulic systems to catch stray animals in the city. According to a civic official, a tender for such vehicles will be issued soon. "A minimum of one vehicle will be given to each ward and its number may increase as per the requirement," said PMC official Jalinder Kharmade.

205.title: N Korea may soon launch new missile submarine: US-based think tank
205.article_body: North Korea might be preparing to launch a new submarine believed to be capable of firing ballistic missiles, a US-based think tank 38 North said, citing commercial satellite imagery. The images by the Sinpho South Shipyard from September 18 show never-seen-before vessels gathered around the construction hall quay. In May this year, North Korea test-fired a submarine-launched ballistic missile.

206.title: US President Joe Biden appears lost on stage after his speech; video surfaces
206.article_body: A video of US President Joe Biden appearing lost on stage after his speech at an event has surfaced on social media. The US President was addressing the Global Fund's Seventh Replenishment Conference in New York on Wednesday. After his address, he turned to leave the podium but stopped and looked lost.

207.title: SBI stock falls marginally after it raises ₹4,000 crore via bonds
207.article_body: A day after the State Bank of India raised ₹4,000 crore Basel III compliant Tier 2 bonds, its shares traded lower on Thursday. At 11:50 am, it was trading at ₹566.05 apiece, down 0.64% on NSE. SBI's issue was oversubscribed by about five times against the base issue size of ₹2,000 crore with bids of ₹9,647 crore.

208.title: Comedian Raju Srivastava cremated in Delhi
208.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava was cremated at Nigambodh Ghat crematorium in Delhi on Thursday. He passed away on Wednesday at the age of 58. Srivastava was admitted to the All India Institute Of Medical Sciences in Delhi last month after suffering a heart attack and collapsing while working out at a gym.

209.title: Why do you need 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', India is strongly united: Amarinder Singh
209.article_body: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh questioned the need for Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "In the first instance, why do you need a 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'? India is strongly united already and is going from strength to strength," Singh added. "Yes, you may need to unite Congress and you should've named it appropriately. Maybe, it would've helped," he stated.

210.title: My father ran out of money in 90s, me & my brother supported him: Musk
210.article_body: The world’s richest person Elon Musk on Twitter revealed that his father, Errol, ran out of money in the 90s and that it was he and his brother who financially supported him. Musk was responding to a thread wherein a US professor claimed that Musk's family owned emerald mines in Apartheid-era South Africa, to which Musk called him a "liar".

211.title: HRERA restricts sale, purchase of properties in Gurugram's Vatika project
211.article_body: The Haryana Real Estate Regulatory Authority (HRERA) has restricted sale and purchase of properties in Vatika Limited's residential projects in Gurugram's sector 88A and 88B, the authority said in a statement. Stating the reason behind the restriction, HRERA said that licence of the project expired in 2019 and the developer is yet to submit documents required for completing mandatory registration.

212.title: SpiceJet shares fall most in 3 weeks after DGCA extends ops cap
212.article_body: A day after the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) extended restrictions on SpiceJet to operate at 50% capacity till October 29, its stock was trading 4% down on NSE on Thursday, the most in three weeks. At 11:27 am, it was trading at ₹40.15, down 4.06%. DGCA noted that the restrictions were extended "as a matter of abundant caution".

213.title: Tamil Nadu DMK MLA threatens auto firm's CEO, booked; video surfaces
213.article_body: Tamil Nadu DMK MLA SR Raja has been booked for threatening the CEO of an auto firm in Chengalpattu, police said. The incident was caught on camera wherein the MLA can be seen threatening and verbally abusing the firm's employees in Maraimalai Nagar. Raja was booked on Wednesday for using obscene language, trespassing and criminal intimidation, police added.

214.title: Ex-Honduras First Lady gets 14 years in prison on fraud charges
214.article_body: A court in Honduras has sentenced the country's former First Lady Rosa Bonilla to 14 years and one month in prison on charges of fraud and misappropriation of public funds destined for social programs. Bonilla spent around $590,000 meant for low-income children on personal credit card payments, her children's school fees and real estate construction, according to the public ministry.

215.title: Locals get authorities to construct road overnight at gunpoint in Gurugram, 30 booked
215.article_body: Police have booked 30 locals in Gurugram for allegedly threatening officials of Metropolitan Development Authority at gunpoint and forcing workers to construct a patch of road overnight. Police said Hoshiar Singh initiated the quarrel because he wanted a road constructed in front of his petrol pump. Singh said all villagers wanted the road because over 20 mishaps occurred there recently.

216.title: Reliance Retail is in talks to acquire Sephora India rights: Report
216.article_body: Reliance Retail is reportedly in advanced talks to get the rights for beauty retailer Sephora in India. According to a report, if the agreement is reached, Sephora's operations will transfer from Arvind Fashions to Reliance Retail. Sephora, owned by French luxury goods group LVMH, has 25 stores in India with brands in categories such as cosmetics and fragrances, among others.

217.title: Govt has taken revolutionary step in education field by bringing NEP: Thakur
217.article_body: The central government has taken a revolutionary step in the fields of sports, education, skill development and regional language education by bringing New Education Policy, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said. Furthermore, he said, today's era is about women empowerment, the biggest proof of which is that women are advancing in every field, especially education and sports.

218.title: Swiggy delivery agents in Chennai protest against revised payment rules
218.article_body: After Swiggy changed its pay structure this week, delivery agents have been protesting in various locations in Chennai, leading to a disruption in services. The agents alleged that according to the new rules, they would have to finish 180 orders a week to earn ₹11,500. Swiggy said that the new structure is created to provide more flexibility to delivery workers.

219.title: IMD predicts moderate to heavy rainfall in Delhi today, yellow alert issued
219.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted moderate rainfall and thundershowers, with heavy rainfall in one or two places in Delhi for Thursday. The weather agency has also issued a 'yellow' alert in the city for the day. While the maximum temperature is likely to be around 31°C, the minimum temperature registered earlier in the day was 23.8°C.

220.title: PM Modi has a powerful, influential voice on the world stage: UK
220.article_body: After Prime Minister Narendra Modi told Russian President Vladimir Putin that this is not the time for war, UK Foreign Secretary James Cleverly said, "PM Modi has a powerful, influential voice on the world stage." "We know the Russian leadership respects India's voice and position on the world stage. I think PM Modi's intervention is very, very welcome," he added.

221.title: Mumbai Metro sells naming rights of 5 stations for ₹216 crore
221.article_body: The Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation sold naming rights of five stations on the Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ Metro 3 corridor for ₹216 crore. The five stations are Bandra Kurla Complex, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Siddhivinayak Metro Station, Churchgate and Hutatma Chowk. The buyers, including LIC, ICICI Lombard and Kotak Mahindra Bank, will be able to use their names in the stations as prefixes.

222.title: Monthly rent in Bengaluru's JP Nagar rose 13% since 2020: Report
222.article_body: Monthly rentals in Bengaluru's JP Nagar rose by 13 percent to ₹52,000 in 2022 from ₹46,000 in 2020, data from real estate consultant Anarock showed. The data further stated that among seven major cities in India, Bengaluru saw highest capital appreciation of nine percent, which meant average prices per square feet increased to ₹6,200 in 2022 from ₹5,698 in 2020.

223.title: Clarify that Jagan Mohan Reddy is not permanent president: EC to YSRCP
223.article_body: Election Commission (EC) on Wednesday directed YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) to clarify that Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy is not its permanent president. EC added that it "categorically rejects any attempt or even a hint of any organisational post being of permanent nature". This comes amid reports claiming that Reddy has been appointed the party's permanent president.

224.title: 21-yr-old college student shares messages sent by Maroon 5 singer Adam Levine
224.article_body: A 21-year-old college student named Ashley Russell has shared messages that Maroon 5 singer Adam Levine sent her. Russell said that, earlier this year, the Maroon 5 singer would watch her Instagram stories, like her posts and message her directly. "He would like mainly like booty stories," she further said.

225.title: After Johny Lever, Raju Srivastava connected well with audience: Jaaved
225.article_body: Jaaved Jaaferi said Raju Srivastava was the only comedian after Johny Lever who connected well with the audience. "He bridged the gap between English and non-English speaking audience through his comedy shows," Jaaved said. He said Raju's "earthy" humour catered to a wide Indian sensibility. "Wherever he stood among the people, he used to make them laugh," he added.

226.title: 7 injured as car rams into pedestrians in Mumbai, CCTV footage surfaces
226.article_body: Seven people were seriously injured after a car rammed into them, while also hitting auto-rickshaws and a tempo in Mumbai's Ghatkopar on Wednesday. The incident, which was captured on CCTV, took place around 1.37 pm when an auto-rickshaw driver entered his friend's car to charge his mobile and accidentally accelerated it. Police arrested the accused on charges of negligent driving.

227.title: N Korea denies sending arms to Russia, asks US to 'keep mouth shut'
227.article_body: North Korea said it has "never exported weapons or ammunition to Russia" and has no plans to do so. This comes after US said that Russia was buying artillery shells and rockets from communist North Korea to support its war in Ukraine. The US should stop making "reckless remarks" and "keep its mouth shut", a North Korean defence official said.

228.title: Hijab may promote diversity, make students culturally sensitive: Supreme Court
228.article_body: While hearing the Karnataka hijab ban case, the Supreme Court on Wednesday said, "One can also say, this is an opportunity of being exposed to diversity. We have students from all cultures, religions...look at diversity of the country, be culturally sensitive towards them." It added, "It can be an opportunity to inculcate some values. That can also be a perspective."

229.title: Called 'gaddar', but we're true torchbearers of Balasaheb's ideals: Maha CM
229.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde criticised Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray for "betraying" the Hindutva ideology and called himself as the true torchbearer of the ideals of Balasaheb Thackeray. "We're being called 'gaddar' (betrayers), but it is we who took Balasaheb's ideals forward, while they shortchanged the ideals of Hindutva," he added.

230.title: Delivery man cheats e-commerce firm of ₹7.6 lakh in Pune; arrested
230.article_body: A 24-year-old delivery agent of an e-commerce platform was arrested for allegedly cheating the firm of ₹7.63 lakh in Pune. According to a company representative, the accused rescheduled the delivery of a product that he had already delivered to the customer and collected money for. Instead of passing the amount to the company, he kept it for himself.

231.title: Shah Rukh Khan is the easiest person I’ve met: Gauri Khan
231.article_body: Gauri Khan said her husband and superstar Shah Rukh Khan is the "easiest person" she has ever met. "He's just born a person who's comfortable with people around him. Put him in any situation, he just knows how to deal with it, be comfortable and not throw his weight around. That's one thing I just love about him," she said.

232.title: Russia frees 215 Ukrainians, others in exchange for 55 including Putin ally
232.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said 215 Ukrainian and foreign citizens have been released by Russia in a prisoner exchange. Russia received 55 prisoners including Viktor Medvedchuk, an ex-Ukrainian lawmaker and ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin accused of treason, he added. The swap is the biggest exchange between the two sides since the start of Russia's invasion in February.

233.title: Get your home festive ready with Alexa Smart Home Combo: Amazon
233.article_body: In the lead-up to Amazon Great Indian Festival, Amazon has announced that customers can convert their homes into smart homes with Alexa Smart Home combos starting at ₹1799. With the festival beginning from 23rd September, the brand aims to encourage people to get their wishlist ready before the sale.

234.title: India reports 5,443 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 46,342
234.article_body: India has reported 5,443 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's data. The data showed that 5,291 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country stood at 46,342. This comes a day after 4,510 new COVID-19 cases were reported in India.

235.title: United Opposition will throw BJP out of power in LS polls: Lalu Yadav
235.article_body: RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav on Wednesday announced that he and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will meet Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi soon in Delhi. "I'll also meet Rahul Gandhi after the completion of his 'padyatra'. The united Opposition will throw...BJP out of power in the next Lok Sabha polls," Lalu said at the RJD state council meeting in Patna.

236.title: upGrad to invest ₹40 mn more in Harappa Education after acquisition
236.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad will invest an additional $40 million in Harappa Education, an online learning platform, to create Harappa Global School of Leadership. upGrad had announced the acquisition of Harappa Education in July 2022 at a valuation of $38 million. In August 2022, upGrad announced securing an additional $210 million from ETS Global and Bodhi Tree among others.

237.title: 11th accused in Amravati murder case arrested from Mumbai court premises
237.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Wednesday arrested the eleventh accused in the murder case of 54-year-old Amravati pharmacist Umesh Kolhe from the premises of a Mumbai court. The accused had come to surrender before the special court hearing the case, his lawyer said. Kolhe was killed on June 21 after he shared a post purportedly supporting Nupur Sharma's Prophet remarks.

238.title: NSE adds Ambuja Cements and Can Fin Homes to today's F&O ban list
238.article_body: The NSE has added Ambuja Cements and Can Fin Homes to its Futures and Options (F&O) ban list for Thursday after the scrips crossed 95% of the market-wide position limit. On Wednesday, shares of Ambuja Cements fell nearly 6% to ₹541, while Can Fin Homes declined more than 2% to ₹552.4. The exchange, however, removed India Cements from the list.

239.title: 4 minors dead, 2 injured as wall collapses in UP's Etawah amid heavy rain
239.article_body: At least four minors were killed and two others were injured after a wall collapsed amid heavy rainfall in Uttar Pradesh's Etawah. "CM Yogi Adityanath has given instructions to provide relief amount of ₹4 lakh to the next of kin of the deceased," the Chief Minister's office tweeted. Reportedly, the deceased belonged to the same family and were siblings.

240.title: Ranveer, Kareena & Ahan Shetty are my fashion icons: Janhvi Kapoor
240.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor called Ranveer Singh, Kareena Kapoor Khan and Ahan Shetty her fashion icons. Speaking at an event, Janhvi said Ahan "dresses really well", while Ranveer has made an identity of his own and never fails to keep up with audiences' expectations. Janhvi said Kareena carries herself with confidence. "I just can't stop looking at her," she added.

241.title: Man dressed as woman thrashed in Noida over child theft suspicion; 4 held
241.article_body: The GB Nagar Police arrested four people for allegedly thrashing a man in Yakubpur village over suspicions of child theft. The victim, Rahul, was roaming in Yakubpur dressed as a woman and someone spread the rumour that he is a child kidnapper following which the villagers thrashed and later paraded him around the village, the police said.

242.title: TV actor Mahesh Thakur cheated of ₹5.43 crore by his lawyer, case filed
242.article_body: The Mumbai police have registered a case after TV actor Mahesh Thakur was cheated of ₹5.43 crore on the pretext of payment for court fees, legal counselling and other formalities in a legal case. As per the police, Thakur had hired the accused to represent him in a property dispute case. When Thakur asked for the receipts, the accused disappeared.

243.title: D2C firm Join Ventures raises $23.5 mn in Series B funding round
243.article_body: A direct-to-consumer firm Join Ventures has secured $23.5 million in Series B funding round led by MO Alternate Investment Advisors Pvt Ltd. According to a company statement, the round saw participation of Convivialité Ventures along with existing investors like DSG Consumer Partners, Venture Catalysts and ZNL Growth. In February, Join Ventures had raised $10 million in Series A funding round.

244.title: Pune municipal body approves ₹5 crore to beautify public toilets
244.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has approved ₹5 crore to beautify public toilets in the city. "Under the beautification process, PMC will carry out works like changing flooring, installing hand wash basins etc," said an official. "At some places, PMC would need to change the urinal and toilet seats as they are damaged," added the official.

245.title: Sensex falls 370 points, Nifty opens at 17,584 after Fed rate hike
245.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in the red on Thursday amid weak global markets following the US Federal Reserve raising interest rates by 75 basis points. The Sensex fell 370.75 points to 59,086.03, and Nifty was down 133.80 points at 17,584.50. Rupee opened at a fresh record low after falling 31 paise at 80.28 per US dollar against Wednesday's close of 79.97.

246.title: Your healthy lifestyle starts with picking the right cooking oil: Oleev
246.article_body: Oleev Active with the goodness of olive oil is specially created to fulfil the demands of the modern lifestyle, said the brand. It has an Energocules formula that will ensure you stay active and energized throughout the day, it revealed, adding that after all, you are what you eat.

247.title: BJP govt tried every possible way to make us scared: Tejashwi Yadav
247.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government has tried every possible way to make them scared. "There were big hurdles before us, still we were not afraid of BJP and formed government in Bihar," Yadav added. "CM Nitish Kumar took decision at the right time and threw the BJP out of power in Bihar," he stated.

248.title: ₹50 lakh worth of items stolen from jewellery shop in Mumbai
248.article_body: Some unidentified persons allegedly stole nearly ₹50 lakh worth of jewellery from a shop in Mumbai's Ghatkopar on Tuesday night. The suspects reportedly entered the shop through a broken window and made off with gold and silver jewellery kept in the showcase. The police said they have strong leads and should be able to make arrests soon.

249.title: If it's hate speech we feed on, where is our nation headed?: SC on hate speech on TV
249.article_body: Expressing its displeasure over hate speeches via debates on TV channels, the Supreme Court on Wednesday called the "visual media" the "chief medium of hate speech". Justice KM Joseph said, "The most important point is where is our nation headed. If it is hate speech that we are actually feeding on, where is our nation headed?"

250.title: Graphic shows rush of flights leaving Russia after Putin's threat
250.article_body: A graphic shared by global flight tracking service Flightradar24 shows flights leaving Russia after the country's President Vladimir Putin's threat to the West. Putin accused the West of "nuclear blackmail" and said, "If...threatened, we'll use all available means to protect our people - this isn't a bluff." The UK later said, Putin's threats must be taken very seriously.

251.title: Rupee hits record low of 80.28 against US dollar after Fed rate hike
251.article_body: The rupee hit a fresh record low on Thursday after it opened at 80.28 against the US dollar. The currency slipped 0.39% in the opening trade against yesterday’s closing of 79.97. After the US Federal Reserve hiked interest rates by 75 basis points on Wednesday, the US dollar surged to a 20-year high at 111.63.

252.title: Shinde has gone again to perform 'mujra' in Delhi: Thackeray on Vedanta project
252.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday said CM Eknath Shinde has gone again to perform "mujra" in Delhi. His statement came following Vedanta-Foxconn's decision to set up a semiconductor facility in Gujarat. "Why do Maharashtra projects go to other states? Why doesn't he speak to PM about this? Doesn't he have the courage to speak on it?" Thackeray asked.

253.title: Meta looking to cut costs by at least 10% within next few months: Report
253.article_body: Meta is reportedly looking to cut its costs by at least 10% within the next few months. As per a report, Meta has started reorganising departments in terms of staff and asking the affected employees to apply for other roles within the company. Earlier, Meta said it had cut plans to hire engineers by at least 30% this year.

254.title: Traffic police officer hit by speeding car in Gurugram, case filed
254.article_body: A case has been filed after a traffic police official was allegedly hit by a speeding car in Gurugram's Sector-12 area on Tuesday. According to reports, Assistant Sub-Inspector Mukhtyar Singh was managing traffic when he signalled a car with tinted glass windows to stop. However, the driver allegedly stepped on the accelerator and fled, leaving Singh injured, reports stated.

255.title: Partha Chatterjee remanded to judicial custody till Oct 5 in WB SSC scam
255.article_body: Former West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee and three others were remanded to judicial custody till October 5 in connection with the School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam. This comes after a court sent the suspended TMC leader to CBI custody till September 21. Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee were arrested by the ED on July 23.

256.title: 30-yr-old kills self in Pune after failing to clear competitive exams
256.article_body: A 30-year-old man died by suicide in Pune due to depression over failing to clear competitive exams despite several attempts, said police. The deceased, who came to Pune from Jalna to prepare for the exams a few years ago, was found locked inside the quarters he shared with his friends. A note was found.

257.title: Trains on main line delayed due to technical glitch at Mumbai's Dadar station
257.article_body: Trains running on the main line were delayed due to a technical problem in signal initiation at Mumbai's Dadar station on Thursday morning, the Central Railways informed. Sharing an update on it, an official said that the problem of signal initiation was examined by staff/officials and resolved but trains on the main line are running late due to bunching.

258.title: 16 COVID-19 deaths reported in last 3 weeks in Thane
258.article_body: About 16 people succumbed to COVID-19 in last three weeks in Maharashtra's Thane. According to Thane's health department, all deceased were aged between 58-60 years and had co-morbidities. However, officials added that the number of infections reduced from around 200-300 per day in August to around 100-180 cases in September, with 50-70 cases being reported daily over last three days.

259.title: Telecom dept director, engineer arrested in Pune over bribery charges
259.article_body: CBI arrested the director and an assistant divisional engineer of the Telecommunication Department of the Ministry of Communications, posted in Pune, while they were accepting a bribe. The two officers work in the office of Advisor, Maharashtra Licensed Service Area. Searches were conducted at the residential and office premises of both the accused, officials said.

260.title: Encroachments near Bengaluru's Greenwood Residency demolished by BBMP
260.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) demolished illegal constructions near Greenwood Residency in Sarjapur as the civic body continued its anti-encroachment drive in Mahadevapura zone. BBMP also removed an RCC bridge (reinforced cement concrete) that was built on a drain channel in Kasavanahalli's Valliyamma layout. Several sheds built on drains in Kasavanahalli were also demolished.

261.title: NIA launches 'largest-ever' searches across India against groups backing terror activities
261.article_body: The NIA on Thursday launched a massive nationwide search operation against groups, including PFI, and individuals allegedly supporting terrorists, officials said. In the "largest ever investigation till date", the searches are taking place at the premises of those allegedly involved in terror funding, organising training camps, and radicalising people to join proscribed organisations, they said.

262.title: Mumbai auto, taxi drivers to go on strike from Sept 26 over fare hike
262.article_body: The auto-rickshaw and taxi unions in Mumbai have decided to go on a strike from September 26 over their demand for an increase in fares. They have postponed the strike twice before, following assurances from the state government in the matter. The taxi union has demanded the minimum fare for 1.5 km to be raised from ₹25 to ₹35.

263.title: Gauri Khan speaks on son Aryan's arrest for the 1st time, says 'Nothing can be worse'
263.article_body: During her appearance on Koffee with Karan, Gauri Khan spoke for the first time about son Aryan's arrest last year. "Nothing can be worse than what we've just been through. But where we all stand as a family, I can say that we are in a great space," she said. "We are grateful to everyone who helped us," she added.

264.title: Flying car company backed by Google Co-founder Larry Page to shut down
264.article_body: Kittyhawk, the air-taxi company backed by billionaire Google Co-founder Larry Page, is closing down. In a LinkedIn post, the company said, "We've made the decision to wind down Kittyhawk. We're still working on the details of what’s next." Kittyhawk was founded in 2010 by Sebastian Thrun and had unveiled a demonstration video of a flying car in 2017.

265.title: Truck driver who mowed down 4 in Delhi held from UP, vehicle seized
265.article_body: The truck driver, who mowed down four persons and injured two others in Delhi's Seemapuri, was arrested from Uttar Pradesh's Shamli, police said. The vehicle has also been seized, police added. The driver was driving rashly and negligently, DCP (Shahdara) R Sathiyasundaram said. The accident took place at 1:51 am on Wednesday, following which two persons died on the spot.

266.title: Conspiracy to defame me: K'taka CM as 'PayCM' posters surface in B'luru
266.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said there is a conspiracy to defame him and damage Karnataka's image, as posters cropped up in Bengaluru with the caption 'PayCM' and a QR code with Bommai's photo on it. BJP leaders in the state have been accused of taking 40% of the contract amount as bribe from contractors for all state-sponsored infrastructural works.

267.title: 2 minors kill man for refusing to give ₹200 for gambling in Delhi
267.article_body: Two minors, aged 13 and 15, have been nabbed by the police for allegedly killing a man who refused to give them ₹200 for gambling in Delhi's Patel Nagar, police said on Wednesday. The accused killed him with a knife, iron rods and bricks when he resisted the robbery bid, police said, adding that another accused is still at large.

268.title: Bengaluru's Cubbon Park planning to ban eatables inside park premises
268.article_body: Authorities of Bengaluru's Cubbon Park are planning to ban eatables within the park and have instructed guards to ensure that no food items are taken inside the park's premises. "Our issue is with those who carry disposable parcels inside the park and dump leftovers...We're fine with visitors bringing well-packed lunch boxes from home," the park's Deputy Director HT Balakrishna said.

269.title: Hospital guards assault 2 youths over parking dispute in Noida, video surfaces
269.article_body: Following a parking dispute, guards of Noida's Yatharth Super Speciality Hospital allegedly assaulted two youths with iron rods. The entire incident was caught on a CCTV camera and has now gone viral on social media. According to reports, the guards asked the victims to not park their car outside the hospital, which sparked a fight.

270.title: 2 workers killed, 4 injured as railway wall collapses on them in Thane
270.article_body: At least two workers were killed and four others were injured after a wall in Thane's Dombivli railway station collapsed on Wednesday evening. While the workers were building a new protection wall to prevent encroachments on station premises, the old wall collapsed on them. The six workers were pulled out from under the debris by other workers and local residents.

271.title: Pedestrian dies after NMMC garbage vehicle hits him in Mumbai
271.article_body: A 61-year-old pedestrian died after a garbage vehicle of Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) reportedly hit him on Sunday near Turbhe Naka. The driver of the vehicle allegedly lost control, hitting the deceased as well as a parked car. The police have registered a case against the 45-year-old driver and detained him. The car was also damaged in the incident.

272.title: 5 celebrate birthday on road in Ghaziabad, beat commuters; arrested
272.article_body: Police have arrested five men for celebrating a birthday party on the road in Ghaziabad. According to a police official, the accused stopped commuters and distributed cake. Furthermore, the accused also abused and beat passengers after stopping them. Sub-inspector Sandeep Kumar said that their ruckus created a long jam on the elevated road.

273.title: Arms dealer arrested with 15 pistols & 45 live cartridges in Delhi
273.article_body: Police have arrested a 32-year-old alleged arms supplier with 15 high-quality semi-automatic pistols and 45 live cartridges in Delhi. The arms were meant to be supplied to gangsters in Delhi and Uttar Pradesh, police said. During interrogation, the accused revealed he used to procure firearms from local manufacturers in Uttar Pradesh's Kairana and would sell them in Baghpat and Shamli.

274.title: US Federal Reserve hikes interest rates by 0.75% for the 3rd time in a row
274.article_body: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its benchmark interest rate by 0.75% for the third straight time. The move will raise its key rate to a range of 3.00% to 3.25%, the highest since 2008. US stock indexes rose on Wednesday ahead of the rate hike announcement by the US Federal Reserve System.

275.title: TRS leaders beat toll plaza staff after row over fee in Telangana
275.article_body: TRS leaders thrashed a toll plaza employee on Wednesday in Telangana after a party leader, who's the Sarpanch from Nasurullabad, was asked to pay toll fee. A CCTV footage showed few people getting out of a car and thrashing the employee before more people entered the scene. The plaza was also vandalised. Police have registered a case against both parties.

276.title: YouTuber & motorist TTF Vasan booked for rash driving in Coimbatore
276.article_body: Days after uploading a video of his ride on social media, YouTuber and motorist TTF Vasan was booked for rash and dangerous driving in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore, police said. Vasan had gone on a ride with influencer GP Muthu on Palakkad Main Road and drove his motorcycle at a very high speed causing a threat to people, officials said.

277.title: EAM Jaishankar informs Ukrainian PM of India's position in war
277.article_body: EAM S Jaishankar met Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal on Wednesday at the UN headquarters and told him that India hopes for "cessation of all hostilities" in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. "Discussed their (the war's) consequences, including for food security, energy security and safety of nuclear facilities," Jaishankar tweeted. The leaders met on the sidelines of a UN General Assembly session.

278.title: Rain killed over 550 children in Pak this year: UNICEF official
278.article_body: Rains and floods have killed over 550 children in Pakistan this year and without a surge in aid more children will die, UNICEF, Pakistan official Gerida Birukila said. She added the floods had displaced 3.4 million children. "The world needs to come together and help the children in Pakistan. Together we can save lives," she said.

279.title: England announce schedule for Ashes 2023
279.article_body: The men's Ashes next year will be contested between June 16 to July 31, with Edgbaston, Lord's, Headingley, Old Trafford and The Oval set to host the Tests, the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) announced. The first Test will begin on June 16 at Edgbaston, while the last Test will take place at The Oval starting July 27.

280.title: Where is brilliance, where is the X-factor: Ravi Shastri on Team India's fielding
280.article_body: Talking about India's fielding in the first T20I against Australia, Ravi Shastri said, "Where is brilliance? Where is that X-factor?" He added, "If you look at all the top Indian teams over the years, there is youth and experience. I find the youth missing here and hence the fielding." Australia defeated India in the first T20I by 4 wickets.

281.title: Mamata ready to bury differences with Cong to form anti-BJP front: Pawar
281.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is ready to bury her differences with Congress and come together to form an alliance of opposition parties against the BJP ahead of 2024 polls. "The rank and file of...TMC was highly disappointed with the Congress after the West Bengal elections, but the party chief amended her stand," Pawar added.

282.title: Nepal President refuses to approve amendments to citizenship law
282.article_body: Nepalese President Bidya Devi Bhandari has refused to approve amendments to the country's citizenship law, which seek to give citizenship certificates to children whose parents' whereabouts are unknown. The deadline for Bhandari to sign the bill was Tuesday midnight. The bill has been passed by the Parliament twice, after Bhandari once earlier had sent it back.

283.title: MSME bad loans for banks may rise to 11% by March 2024: Crisil
283.article_body: Crisil Ratings stated that gross NPAs (GNPA) in the MSME segment may rise to around 10-11% by March 2024. It added that the MSME segment saw a restructuring at around 6%, and about a fourth of these accounts could potentially slip into NPAs. GNPA in the MSME segment was approximately 9.3% as on March 31, 2022.

284.title: Chargesheet filed against Teesta Setalvad, 2 others for false evidence
284.article_body: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) filed a chargesheet against activist Teesta Setalvad, retired Director General of Police R B Sreekumar and dismissed IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt for allegedly 'fabricating evidence' in the 2002 Gujarat riots case. The chargesheet is 6,300 pages and cites 90 witnesses. Teesta Setalvad, arrested on June 26, was released on interim bail on September 2.

285.title: Amanatullah's aide arrested in T'gana after pistol found at premises
285.article_body: The Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested Aam Aadmi Party MLA Amanatullah Khan's close aide Kaushar Imam Siddique under the Arms Act in Telangana. The 47-year-old was wanted after a country-made pistol and three live rounds were found at his premises. Khan's another aide, Hamid Ali, has also been arrested. Khan is an accused in the Delhi Waqf Board corruption case.

286.title: India's mineral production falls 3.3% in July 2022
286.article_body: According to provisional data by the government, the country's mineral production declined by 3.3% in July 2022 compared to the same month in the previous year. The cumulative year-on-year growth during the April-July period of the ongoing fiscal stood at 6.1%. The important minerals which showed positive growth in July 2022 were phosphorite, coal, copper concentrate, and zinc concentrate.

287.title: Telangana govt to distribute 1 cr Bathukamma sarees from tomorrow
287.article_body: The Telangana government has announced that the annual distribution of Bathukamma sarees to women in the state will begin tomorrow (Thursday). The government will distribute nearly one crore sarees this year. Telangana Textiles and Handlooms Minister KT Rama Rao said the initiative was first launched in 2017 to support weavers amid unemployment and to present a small gift to women.

288.title: US' 'One China' policy remains unchanged: White House
288.article_body: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan has said there is no change in the US' 'One China' policy and it is "against unilateral changes to the status quo". Sullivan's remarks come after President Joe Biden earlier said the US would defend Taiwan in the event of an invasion. Under the "One China" policy, Taiwan is a part of China.

289.title: Danish queen COVID +ve after attending Queen Elizabeth's funeral
289.article_body: Danish Queen Margrethe II has tested positive for COVID-19 after she attended British Queen Elizabeth II’s funeral, the palace said on Wednesday. Eighty-two-year-old Margrethe tested positive on Tuesday night and her official duties have been cancelled. Margrethe, who has received three doses of the coronavirus vaccine, had also tested COVID-19 positive in February this year.

290.title: Shakira breaks silence on separation from Gerard Piqué, calls it 'incredibly difficult'
290.article_body: Shakira described her breakup from Gerard Piqué as "incredibly difficult" in her first comments since the couple of 11 years parted ways. "It's hard to talk about it, especially because I'm still going through it...and because our separation is not like a regular separation," she stated. Shakira said she has tried to conceal the situation in front of her children.

291.title: You tell me, I don't know: Pandya after reporter asks him about turning point in 1st T20I
291.article_body: On being asked about what the turning point was in the first T20I against Australia, Hardik Pandya sarcastically responded to the reporter, saying, "You tell me, I don't know." He added, "If we knew, we would have stopped it in the field." He further said, "There are still two matches in the series, so we will make a come back."

292.title: Israeli PM, Turkish Prez meet for 1st time in 14 years
292.article_body: The Prime Minister of Israel and the President of Turkey have met for the first time in 14 years in New York on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly. During the meeting with Turkey's Recep Tayyip Erdogan, Israel's Yair Lapid “commended” the recent process to restore full diplomatic ties. Israel and Turkey had earlier differed over the Palestine issue.

293.title: Indian exports to Gulf countries grew by 44% in 2021-22: FIEO
293.article_body: The Federation of Indian Export Organisations (FIEO) reported that India's exports to six Gulf Cooperation Council countries grew by 44% to about $43.9 billion in 2021-22. UAE led the trade with exports worth $28 billion, showing a 68% growth compared to the previous fiscal year. India has a 16% market share in GCC and is targeting 25% by 2027.

294.title: India Women squad for T20 Asia Cup 2022 announced
294.article_body: The BCCI on Wednesday announced the India Women squad for the T20 Asia Cup 2022. Jemimah Rodrigues, who recovered from an injury recently, has returned to the squad. The squad also includes Richa Ghosh, KP Navgire, Dayalan Hemalatha and Sabbineni Meghana among others. The tournament will be held in Bangladesh from October 1 to 15.

295.title: Won't take any sides in Congress president polls: Sonia Gandhi
295.article_body: Congress Interim Chief Sonia Gandhi after meeting Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said she'll not take any sides in upcoming election for the next party president. As per reports, she conveyed the same to Congress MP Shashi Tharoor when he met her two days ago. Party leader Jairam Ramesh earlier said nobody needs anybody's nod to contest the polls.

296.title: TikTok bans US political accounts from fundraising, campaigning
296.article_body: ByteDance-owned TikTok will require accounts of the US government, politicians and political parties to be verified ahead of the US midterm elections in November. Calling itself an entertainment platform, TikTok, in a blog post, also said political accounts will be barred from accessing advertising features. Features like digital payments and gifting will also not be accessible to these accounts.

297.title: 'Brahmāstra' served as one tight slap to the boycott gang: Trade analyst
297.article_body: Trade analyst Atul Mohan said Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Brahmāstra' has done well at the box office. "The industry has come out of the negativity...'Brahmāstra' served as one tight slap to [the boycott gang]," he added. Taran Adarsh stated the comparisons in the box office collection of 'The Kashmir Files' and 'Brahmāstra' aren't correct due to the difference in the budget.

298.title: Software firm [24]7.ai to add 9,000 employees across India in FY23
298.article_body: Global customer service software and services company [24]7.ai has said that it's planning to add 9,000 new employees to its workforce in 2022-23 from all over India. With the work from anywhere options, [24]7.ai said it'd be hiring across voice and chat processes to serve its international client base. The company said it'd hired 5,000 people from India last year.

299.title: 3 new species of snakes discovered in graves & churches in Ecuador
299.article_body: Three new species of underground snakes hidden under graveyards and churches in Ecuador have been discovered by scientists. These snakes are small, cylindrical and archaic-looking and belong to the genus Atractus. Though it's the most species-rich snake genus in the world, these snakes are lesser known as they remain hidden throughout most of their lives owing to their shy nature.

300.title: 46-yr-old woman Maoist leader surrenders before T'gana police
300.article_body: Senior Maoist leader Madavi Hademe alias Savitri, the Divisional Committee Member of South Bastar Division, surrendered before Telangana Police on Wednesday. The 46-year-old participated in five attacks on security forces and four ambushes during her underground life, a press release stated. She was frustrated with "mindless violence and aimless protracted armed struggle of CPI(Maoist)", it said.

301.title: 'Thackeray' movie was made with Sanjay Raut's black money: ED witness
301.article_body: Swapna Patkar, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's former aide and the ED's prime witness in the Patra Chawl case, has alleged that Raut's family-owned entity produced the film 'Thackeray' with his unaccounted money. "Apart from investing unaccounted money in the above-mentioned projects, [Raut] nowadays started routing his unaccounted money through various shell companies," Patkar added.

302.title: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly passes 9 bills by voice vote
302.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly on Wednesday passed nine bills, including Andhra Pradesh Labour Welfare Fund (Second Amendment) Bill 2022 and Andhra Pradesh Shops and Establishments (Amendment) Bill 2022. The House also passed Urban Development Authorities (Amendment) Bill 2022 and Andhra Pradesh Municipal Laws (Amendment) Bill 2022. Notably, all bills were passed by voice vote.

303.title: Will worship Ambedkar now: K'taka Dalit family fined ₹60,000 for touching idol
303.article_body: A 15-year-old Dalit boy touched a pole during a religious procession in a village in Karnataka, following which his family was asked to pay a fine of ₹60,000. "We will offer our prayers to Dr BR Ambedkar," said Shobamma, the 15-year-old boy's mother. What's the point of offering prayers if God doesn't like our touch? she asked.

304.title: Kuku FM raises $21.8 mn in round led by Nandan Nilekani's Fundamentum
304.article_body: Audio content platform Kuku FM has raised $21.8 million in its Series B1 funding round which was led by Nandan Nilekani-backed Fundamentum Partnership. As part of this investment, Prateek Jain, a Principal at Fundamentum, will join Kuku's board. Kuku was founded in 2018 by Lal Chand Bisu, Vikas Goyal and Vinod Kumar Meena and currently has 1.6 million paid subscribers.

305.title: Hotter climate may lead to increase in kidney stone disease: Study
305.article_body: Rising temperature due to climate crisis could lead to an increase in kidney stone disease, a study stated. Researchers said cases of kidney stones have increased in the last 20 years, mostly in women and adolescents. They also found a sharp rise in patients with the condition following hotter days in the US, indicating impact of climate change on health.

306.title: Raju Srivastava's career was like a rollercoaster: Aasif Sheikh
306.article_body: Actor Aasif Sheikh has said that late comedian Raju Srivastava's career was like a rollercoaster. "He had no work and then 'The Great Indian Laughter Challenge' happened and he became a star and how! He was a positive person even during bad times," Aasif added. He added that Raju was a game changer in comedy.

307.title: Not about collection: FFI committee head on not picking RRR for Oscars
307.article_body: Film Federation of India (FFI) committee head TS Nagabharana has said that the idea behind picking 'Chhello Show (Last Film Show)' for Oscars was to have a film which represents India in a different way. Speaking about people's reaction to 'RRR' or 'The Kashmir Files' not being picked, he said, "The story matters not the collection or popularity."

308.title: Edtech startup Bhanzu raises $15 mn in Series A funding round
308.article_body: Edtech startup Bhanzu raised $15 million in a Series A funding round led by Eight Roads Ventures and Facebook co-founder's VC firm B Capital. Bhanzu reportedly raised the funds at a valuation of $105 million. The math learning platform was founded in 2020 by Neelakantha Bhanu, who holds four world records for being the Fastest Human Calculator in the World.

309.title: India Women record their highest-ever ODI total on England soil
309.article_body: India Women on Wednesday recorded their highest-ever ODI total on England soil by registering 333/5 in their 50 overs in second ODI at St Lawrence Ground in Canterbury. India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur top-scored with 143*(111), including 18 fours and four sixes. India Women's previous highest ODI total on England soil was 281/3, registered on June 24, 2017 in Derby.

310.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
310.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy rainfall warning for several states till September 25. Heavy rainfall is likely over parts of Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh till September 25. It's very likely over Arunachal Pradesh till September 24. Further, it is likely over Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan and Assam till September 23.

311.title: Rescue Indians held illegally in Myanmar: TN CM writes to PM Modi
311.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi and requested the immediate rescue and safe repatriation of Indians held in illegal captivity in Myanmar. Stalin stated he has received information that around 300 Indians, including 50 Tamils, are stuck and facing severe hardships. State government is in touch with 17 such Tamils, Stalin stated.

312.title: Jupiter will be its closest to Earth in 59 years on September 26: NASA
312.article_body: On September 26, Jupiter will be its closest to the Earth in the last 59 years, NASA said. On this day, Jupiter will be directly opposite the sun as viewed from Earth, an astronomical arrangement known as opposition, which happens every 13 months. But opposition rarely coincides with Jupiter's closest approach to the Earth, making it a rare event.

313.title: 45 kg poppy seized from Jammu and Kashmir's Samba, 2 arrested
313.article_body: Police seized over 45 kg of poppy from a Punjab-bound bus in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district and arrested two persons in connection with the case, officials said on Wednesday. A police team intercepted the bus on the Jammu-Pathankot national highway at AIIMS checkpoint. The driver and the conductor were then arrested, the officials added.

314.title: Crocodile spotted inside government school in UP's Aligarh
314.article_body: A crocodile was spotted by students in a government school in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. The school was located in Qasimpur village, and Divisional Forest Officer (DFO) Diwakar Vashisht said that the crocodile was taken and was released into the River Ganga. Villagers claimed that they imprisoned it in a classroom till a State Forest department official came and captured it.

315.title: Eateries in B'luru can't operate 24x7, but will consider plea: CM
315.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that eateries and restaurants in Bengaluru cannot operate 24x7 but a decision may be taken to change the rules in the future. Bommai added that the request would be considered at the earliest. In April, the Bruhat Bengaluru Hotels and Restaurants Association(BBHRA) sought permission to run establishments 24x7.

316.title: Future Enterprises defaults on ₹15.73 cr interest payment for NCDs
316.article_body: Future Enterprises, a part of Future Group, on Wednesday said that it defaulted on an interest payment of ₹15.73 on Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs). The default occurred for the period March 21, 2022, to September 19, 2022 and the gross principal amount on which it occurred is ₹327 crore. The company had earlier defaulted on another interest payment of ₹4.10 crore.

317.title: Kurmi community's 'Rail Roko' protest for ST status continues in WB
317.article_body: The 'Rail Roko' protest in West Bengal by members of the Kurmi community entered its second day on Wednesday. The protesters are demanding for Scheduled Tribe (ST) status and the inclusion of Kurmali language in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution. The protesters blocked railway tracks at stations including Kharagpur, Khemasuli and Purulia, resulting in the cancellation of 53 trains.

318.title: Worked as assistant in Raju Srivastava's film when I was 18: Krushna
318.article_body: Actor-comedian Krushna Abhishek revealed that he began his career as an assistant to director Lawrence D'souza in the film which featured late comedian Raju Srivastava when he was 18 years old. "We went on to do so many television and live shows together. [Raju] was genuinely a nice person, my condolences to the family," he added.

319.title: There is a will to re-engage: French Prez after meeting Liz Truss
319.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron met British PM Liz Truss in New York on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly. After the meeting, Macron said they discussed the Russia-Ukraine war and issues of the European Union. "There is a will to re-engage, to move on and to show that we are allies and friends in a complex world," he said.

320.title: Businesses that can't be audited won't be permitted: SEBI Chief
320.article_body: SEBI Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch said that any business that operates on the 'black box' model that cannot be audited or validated will not be permitted. Amid reports that the market regulator might clamp down on algo trading, Buch said, "We are not for or against algo trading as long as there is sufficient transparency and disclosures".

321.title: Mark Zuckerberg shares pic with wife to announce they're expecting 3rd baby girl
321.article_body: Facebook Co-founder and Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced he and his wife Priscilla Chan Zuckerberg are expecting third baby girl. Sharing a picture with Priscilla on Instagram, Mark wrote, "Lots of love. Happy to share that Max and August are getting a new baby sister next year!" The couple are already parents to two girls aged six and five.

322.title: Man involved in murder of Suresh Raina's relatives arrested in UP
322.article_body: A man involved in murder of Suresh Raina's relatives has been arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar. The suspect had been wanted by police since August 2020, when more than a dozen members of a gang entered the house of Raina's uncle and aunt in Pathankot. Raina's uncle and cousin were killed in the attack.

323.title: Apple may move a quarter of iPhone production to India by 2025: Report
323.article_body: JP Morgan analysts have said that Apple may make one out of four iPhones in India by 2025. The analysts expected that the company could move about 5% of iPhone 14 production from late 2022 to India. This comes as Apple is reportedly moving some production away from China amid mounting geopolitical tensions and strict COVID-19 lockdowns in the nation.

324.title: 'Seeking owner's manzoori'?: BJP on Gehlot, Tharoor meeting Sonia
324.article_body: Responding to reports of Congress leaders Ashok Gehlot and Shashi Tharoor meeting Sonia Gandhi, BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla asked, "In which election does the candidate meet and seek 'manzoori' from the family to contest an election?" Poonawalla said the meetings prove the Congress is not a party but a "family firm or a private limited company".

325.title: Good realisation: BJP as Savarkar's pic appears on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' posters
325.article_body: Sharing photos showing Veer Savarkar's image on a poster for Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', BJP IT Cell chief Amit Malviya said, "Although belated, good realisation for [Congress leader] Rahul Gandhi." "Oops! It seems all attempts by Rahul to obfuscate history didn't work," BJP National Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said. "Later on they tried to cover it up! Savarkar Zindabad," Poonawalla added.

326.title: BJP's Coimbatore district chief arrested for threatening A Raja
326.article_body: The BJP's Coimbatore district chief Balaji Uthamaramasamy was arrested on Wednesday for threatening former Union Minister and DMK leader A Raja. On Monday, Raja had criticised the Hindu concept of 'Sanatana Dharma'. In response, Uthamaramasamy had questioned Raja's knowledge on the subject and challenged him to set foot in Coimbatore without police protection.

327.title: 8.5 lakh trees to be cut as govt approves megaproject in Great Nicobar
327.article_body: Union Environment Ministry's Expert Appraisal Committee has given its nod for the development of a strategically-crucial project in Great Nicobar Island. It will involve felling of around 8.5 lakh trees in pristine rainforests and loss of 12-20 hectares of mangrove cover. The project involves development of a military-civil airport and international container trans-shipment terminal, among others.

328.title: Deeply alarmed by attacks against Hindus in Leicester: VHP writes to UK PM
328.article_body: The VHP on Wednesday wrote to UK Prime Minister Liz Truss seeking action against the "continued violence against Hindus in Leicester and Birmingham by Islamic extremists". In a letter to Truss, VHP said that it is "deeply concerned and alarmed", adding that Hindus are being terrorised to remove symbols of their heritage, tradition, culture and religion.

329.title: Honda overpays bonuses to employees at US plant, asks employees to return money
329.article_body: Honda has asked hundreds of employees at its vehicle plant in US' Ohio to pay back part of their bonuses after claiming that it overpaid them. The Japanese car manufacturer gave employees nine days to return part of their bonus money. "Not a lot of people can handle this kind of a hit," the wife of a Honda employee said.

330.title: Inshorts Co-founder & CEO Azhar Iqubal named 'Entrepreneur of the Year (Media)'
330.article_body: Inshorts Co-founder and CEO Azhar Iqubal has been named 'Entrepreneur of the Year' in the media category at Entrepreneur Awards 2022 organised by Entrepreneur India magazine. The award recognises an entrepreneur who has done phenomenal work in the field of media, the magazine said. Founded in 2013, Inshorts operates 60-word news app Inshorts and location-based social media platform Public.

331.title: NASA's DART captures Jupiter & its 4 moons ahead of crashing into asteroid
331.article_body: NASA's DART spacecraft has captured the image of Jupiter and its four moons. From left to right in the picture, you can see Ganymede, Jupiter, Europa, Io and Callisto. The image was taken when DART was 700 million kilometres away from Jupiter. The spacecraft will be crashing into Dimorphos to test a planetary defence technique on September 26.

332.title: Assam & Mizoram CMs discuss border dispute, decide to form panel
332.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma and Mizoram CM Zoramthanga met in New Delhi on Wednesday to resolve the decades-old border dispute between their states. Later, Sarma said a regional committee will be formed to settle the dispute. The border dispute had taken a violent turn in July last year when six policemen and one civilian had died in clashes.

333.title: Rohan clarifies comment on Raju Srivastava's death, says 'Today isn't about my feelings'
333.article_body: Comedian Rohan Joshi, who was criticised over his comment on Raju Srivastava's death wherein he wrote 'Good riddance', has clarified after some people asked why he deleted the comment. "I deleted it because after a minute of anger I realised today isn't about my personal feelings," he wrote. "Sorry if it hurt and thanks for the perspective," Rohan added.

334.title: Don't open mails, click on links from our 2K Games unit: Take-Two
334.article_body: Take-Two Interactive Software, the parent-company of Rockstar Games, on Wednesday warned users not to open mails or click on links received from its unit 2K Games. Take-Two said a hacker accessed 2K Games' help desk platform and sent a malicious link to certain customers. 2K Games' support portal will remain offline while it continues to address the issue, Take-Two said.

335.title: Gehlot or Tharoor will be 'puppet' in hands of Rahul: BJP on Cong Prez poll
335.article_body: BJP on Monday said whosoever becomes Congress President, whether Ashok Gehlot or Shashi Tharoor, will only be a "puppet" in the hands of Rahul Gandhi, who will be the "main driver". BJP leader Tom Vadakkan also dubbed Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' as "Corruption Jodo Yatra", saying it started with "2G partners" of DMK. The yatra has entered its 14th day.

336.title: We'll make madrasa students ideal citizens, not stone-pelters: UP Minister
336.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Cabinet Minister Dharam Pal Singh on Wednesday said the state government is undertaking surveys of madrasas so that students studying there get a better education. "We'll make these madrasa students ideal citizens, engineers and doctors. We'll not make them stone-pelters," Singh said. "SP, BSP, Congress...fear loss of Muslim vote...BJP doesn't see [Muslims] as a vote bank," he added.

337.title: New technique 'Virtual Autopsy' used for Raju Srivastava's post-mortem, says AIIMS
337.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava's post-mortem has been conducted with a new technique called Virtual Autopsy, said Dr Sudhir Gupta, Head, Department of Forensic Medicine, AIIMS. "It does not require any dissection. The whole process took 15 to 20 minutes, after which the body was handed over to his family," the doctor added. The comedian passed away aged 58.

338.title: Why is Centre a mute spectator?: SC on hate speech incidents on TV channels
338.article_body: The Supreme Court, while hearing a plea regarding incidents of hate speech on TV channels, asked why the Centre is remaining a "mute spectator". "The government should not take an adversarial stand but assist. Why haven't you filed counter?" the SC said. It added that the role of TV anchors is "very critical" in ensuring that hate speech doesn't continue.

339.title: Bill to ban stray cattle's movement in urban areas withdrawn in Guj
339.article_body: The Gujarat Assembly on Wednesday unanimously withdrew a bill that was aimed at prohibiting the movement of stray cattle on roads and public places in urban areas. The bill was passed in April this year. It asked cattle-rearers to obtain a licence to keep them and get them tagged. The bill added that failing this may lead to imprisonment.

340.title: Man climbs transmission tower in Bhilai as wife refuses to return home
340.article_body: A man climbed a high-tension transmission tower in Chhattisgarh's Bhilai on Tuesday after his wife refused to return home from her parents' house. He had reportedly reached his in-laws' house to pick up his wife when they refused to let her go. "The husband became Dharmendra of Sholay," a netizen said. He was brought to the ground after police intervened.

341.title: AAP pivoting itself to power in name of Nirbhaya; they're BJP's B-team: Cong
341.article_body: Congress' National Media Coordinator Radhika Khera on Wednesday alleged that the Delhi government under CM Arvind Kejriwal was pivoting itself to power "in the name of Nirbhaya" and dubbed AAP as BJP's "B-team". Congress leader Sandeep Dikshit said that Kejriwal's 'Delhi model of governance' is "all about publicity and lacks substance". Delhi model is not development-oriented, he added.

342.title: Working to implement common KYC for financial transactions: FM
342.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said the government is working on the implementation of a common know your customer (KYC) process for carrying out various financial transactions across institutions. "We're...working in such a way that once you've given your KYC, it can be applicable at various institutions at various times for various requirements that you may have," she said.

343.title: Hardik Pandya jumps 22 spots in latest rankings for T20I batters
343.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya jumped 22 places in the latest rankings for T20I batters after smashing 71*(30) against Australia in the first T20I in Mohali. Pandya is now ranked 65th with 446 rating points. Further, all-rounder Axar Patel jumped 24 spots to the 33rd position in rankings for T20I bowlers after taking three wickets during the same match.

344.title: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan's custody extended by 5 days in Waqf Board case
344.article_body: A Delhi court on Wednesday extended AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan's police custody for five more days in the Delhi Waqf Board case. The Okhla MLA was sent to four-day police custody on September 17 after raids at his residence. Anti Corruption Branch said Khan had appointed some friends and relatives as employees in Delhi Waqf Board citing urgency and vacancy.

345.title: I've moved on: Agnihotri on Kashmir Files not being India's Oscar entry
345.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri reacted after his film 'The Kashmir Files' wasn't picked as India's official entry to the Oscars 2023. "I wish them all the luck for the future run. I've nothing else to say...Right now, I'm doing another film and I have moved on," he stated. Gujarati film 'Chhello Show (Last Film Show)' was picked as India's Oscars entry.

346.title: Your dislike doesn't mean Karan Johar is murderer: Swara on Sushant's death
346.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker said there's an atmosphere of fear in the film industry. "In the industry...there's this idea of not engaging in controversy," she added. Speaking about Karan Johar being targeted after Sushant Singh Rajput's death, Swara stated, "You can say a lot of things about Karan Johar...can say his films are obnoxious...but your dislike...doesn't mean that he's a murderer."

347.title: Punjab Governor says no to AAP's special session for trust vote on Sept 22
347.article_body: Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit on Wednesday withdrew the AAP government's order calling for a special Assembly session to hold a trust vote on September 22 (Thursday). The governor cited  "absence of specific rules" to do so. CM Bhagwant Mann had called the session to seek a trust vote amid AAP MLAs' claims of 'Operation Lotus' in the state.
