348.title: Yasin Malik to appear before court in Rubaiya Sayeed abduction case
348.article_body: Jammu & Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) founder Yasin Malik has been ordered to appear in front of a special court in connection with the 1989 abduction case of Rubaiya Sayeed. Malik is currently serving life imprisonment in Tihar jail in a terror funding case. Rubaiya was abducted in December 1989 and was released in exchange for five militants.

349.title: Man arrested in Hyd for murdering vegetable vendor, stealing gold
349.article_body: Hyderabad Police arrested a man for murdering a vegetable vendor and stealing her gold ornaments. The accused was a labourer and befriended the vegetable vendor a few months ago, and he decided to kill her and steal ornaments to get easy money, the police said. He was arrested in Secunderabad's Trimulgherry area and the gold was recovered from his possession.

350.title: Lumpy skin disease in cattle more serious in Rajasthan: Union Minister
350.article_body: Union Animal Husbandry Minister Sanjeev Balyan on Wednesday said the problem of lumpy skin disease is more serious in Rajasthan and about 12.5 lakh cattle have been affected in the state. At present, about 18.5 lakh cattle are affected across the country. The Centre has provided about 30 lakh vaccine doses against lumpy virus to the Rajasthan government, Balyan added.

351.title: NASA captures clearest view of Neptune's rings in more than 30 years
351.article_body: NASA on Wednesday announced that its James Webb Space Telescope has captured the clearest view of Neptune's rings in more than 30 years. "In addition to several bright, narrow rings, the Webb image clearly shows Neptune’s fainter dust bands," NASA said. The images also captured seven of Neptune's 14 known moons: Galatea, Naiad, Thalassa, Despina, Proteus, Larissa, and Triton.

352.title: Will urge Rahul Gandhi again to become Congress chief: Raj CM Gehlot
352.article_body: Ahead of the Congress party's presidential polls, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said he'll urge Rahul Gandhi again to become the president. "I'm fortunate that Congressmen...have faith, love, and trust in me...if they ask me to file nomination, I'll do so," he said. "If it's up to me, then I will not take any posts...I'll join Rahul Gandhi's yatra," he added.

353.title: Permission of Sonia, Rahul not required to contest Presidential poll: Cong
353.article_body: The Congress on Wednesday said no one requires the permission of party President Sonia Gandhi or its leader Rahul Gandhi to contest in its upcoming Presidential elections. "Anybody is free and welcome to contest in the election if they have the backing of 10 PCC delegates," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said. "The elections will be fair and transparent," Ramesh added.

354.title: FIR registered against Kerala professor named in LPU student's suicide note
354.article_body: A case has been registered against a professor at NIT Calicut after his name surfaced on the suicide note of a first-year student at Lovely Professional University (LPU) in Punjab's Jalandhar. The student was rusticated from NIT after which he joined LPU, police said. "He wrote in the note that he is committing suicide due to the professor," police added.

355.title: SP failed to stop BJP from working against people's interests: BSP chief
355.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Wednesday accused the SP of failing to stop the BJP from working against people's interests. "This has set...BJP government free to work against interests and welfare of crores of people...with a completely autocratic, anti-people thinking and working style," she tweeted. "Even in the Legislative Assembly...SP looks very helpless and weak against the government," she said.

356.title: Govt approves ₹19,500-crore PLI scheme on solar PV modules
356.article_body: The government has approved Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme on 'national programme on high efficiency solar PV modules', with an outlay of ₹19,500 crore. Union Minister Anurag Thakur said the PLI is aimed at achieving manufacturing capacity of Giga Watt (GW) scale in high efficiency solar PV modules. Thakur said the scheme will bring direct investment of around ₹94,000 crore.

357.title: India raises fiscal support for local chip, display manufacturing
357.article_body: Indian government announced increasing fiscal support for new semiconductor facilities to cover 50% of project costs. The government added that it will remove the maximum limit of permitted investment for display manufacturing to boost local production. According to the announcement, the government will also cover 50% of the capital expenditure for setting up semiconductor packaging plants.

358.title: Amazon announces 71 new renewable energy projects
358.article_body: Amazon said it would add 2.7 gigawatts of clean energy capacity through 71 new projects, taking its total of renewable energy projects to 379. The projects include three large-scale plants in Rajasthan, rooftop solar projects in France and Austria, and its first solar farm in Poland. It expects to generate 50,000 gigawatt hours of energy from its entire portfolio.

359.title: Banking sector liquidity in deficit for 1st time in 40 months: RBI
359.article_body: India's banking sector liquidity has slipped into a deficit for the first time in 40 months, data from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) showed. RBI infused ₹21,873 crore into the banking system on Tuesday, the highest since May 2019. The Centre is reportedly in no hurry to push inflation, which is near 7%, back to RBI's 4% medium-term target.

360.title: Rahul Gandhi introduced to K-pop by Kerala's BTS Army, video surfaces
360.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had his first lesson in the Korean music genre K-pop and popular band BTS from a group of schoolgirls in Kerala on Tuesday during Congress' ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. The schoolgirls told Gandhi that they wanted to become nurses and work in South Korea and also played a BTS music video for the Congress leader.

361.title: Serentica Renewables in talks to enter green energy generation
361.article_body: Pratik Agarwal, director of Serentica Renewables, said that the company is in talks to scale up its green energy generation capacity to 1,500 MW. The company recently secured a deal with three Vedanta Group companies to supply 580 MW of green power. Agarwal also said the group is in talks with potential investors for investment across green energy.

362.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters released, Suryakumar Yadav overtakes Babar Azam
362.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday released the latest rankings for T20I batters, with India's Suryakumar Yadav overtaking Pakistan's Babar Azam. Suryakumar is now ranked third with 780 rating points, while Babar is fourth with 771 rating points. Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan leads the rankings with 825 rating points. Suryakumar is the only Indian in the top 10.

363.title: CBI arrests ABG Shipyard founder-chairman Rishi Agarwal in ₹22,842-crore bank fraud case
363.article_body: The CBI arrested the founder-chairman of ABG Shipyard Limited, Rishi Kamlesh Agarwal, in connection with an alleged bank fraud of ₹22,842 crore. The company was sanctioned credit facilities from 28 banks and financial institutions led by ICICI Bank, with SBI having an exposure of ₹2,468.51 crore. Funds were used for purposes other than for which they were released, officials said.

364.title: Protests at Pune university over irregularities in exam results, fees
364.article_body: Yuvak Kranti Dal and Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad held two separate protests at Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) on Tuesday against the irregularities related to semester exam results, fees and facilities. They also demanded the appointment of a full-time Vice-Chancellor at SPPU. Minister Chandrakant Patil has instructed the appointment of a nodal officer to hear students' demands.

365.title: SRK shot for 10 days for his cameo in 'Brahmāstra': Ranbir Kapoor
365.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor revealed that Shah Rukh Khan shot for 10 days for his cameo in 'Brahmāstra'. "We all are actors and when we are asked to do guest appearances, it's usually one day or two days which we agree to do, but...he shot for 10 days," Ranbir stated. Director Ayan Mukerji added that they owe Shah Rukh "a lot".

366.title: DRI seizes 394 foreign-origin gold bars worth ₹33 cr from Mumbai, Delhi
366.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has seized 394 foreign-origin gold bars worth over ₹33 crore from Mumbai, Delhi and Patna, which was smuggled from neighbouring countries, according to a statement issued on Wednesday. Under the 'Op Gold Rush', 120 gold bars were seized from Mumbai, 172 from Bihar and 102 from Delhi.

367.title: Youth trying to stop drug mafia's operations beaten to death in Punjab
367.article_body: A young boy trying to stop a drug smuggler from selling drugs in Punjab's Tarn Taran was allegedly beaten to death by the smuggler's men on Wednesday. The victim's family claims that the youth was kept in confinement for two days and that they also received death threats from the smuggler. Police have identified the accused through the crime's video.

368.title: Class 10 Pune boy selected to participate in NASA-led competition
368.article_body: Sonit Sisolekar, a 15-year-old Class 10 student in Pune has been selected to participate in the Great Lunar Expedition for Everyone (GLEE) 2023, a NASA-led competition. Sisolekar said, "Though volcanology is my primary interest, GLEE has given me an opportunity to read about...volcanic activity on the lunar surface." He's a recipient of the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar of 2021.

369.title: Pretty impressive: Verstappen on Red Bull's in-house engines for 2026
369.article_body: F1 world champion Max Verstappen said his team Red Bull's project to build its power units in-house for the 2026 season is "pretty impressive". "I hear all the stories from Christian (Horner) and Helmut (Marko)...It's pretty impressive what they're doing there at the moment, and what's to come," said Verstappen. Red Bull won the 2021 driver's championship with Honda engines.

370.title: Today, you made me cry for 1st time: Kapil Sharma on Raju Srivastava
370.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma took to Instagram and mourned the loss of late comedian Raju Srivastava, who passed away on Wednesday. Kapil shared a picture with Raju and wrote, "Today, for the first time, you made me cry Raju bhai. I wish there would have been one more chance to meet you." Raju passed away at the age of 58.

371.title: JD(U) MLC detained, interrogated by Income Tax Dept at Patna airport
371.article_body: The Income Tax (IT) Department detained JD(U) MLC Dinesh Prasad Singh at Bihar's Patna airport on Tuesday night and interrogated him for three hours. After the interrogation, IT officials were seen leaving the airport with a sealed suitcase. However, Singh said, "They did not find anything, any money, as there was nothing to be found." Singh represents Bihar's Muzaffarpur constituency.

372.title: Raju Srivastava's untimely demise makes me very sad: Ajay Devgn
372.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Twitter and mourned the demise of late comedian Raju Srivastava, who passed away aged 58. "In your lifetime, you gifted us laughs and more laughs, on and off the screen. Your untimely demise makes me very sad," Ajay tweeted. Director Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "There is no such friend or stranger whom Raju didn't make laugh."

373.title: Sonali Phogat had asked for drugs: Aid & murder-accused Sudhir Sangwan
373.article_body: In his confession to the Goa Police, Sonali Phogat's aid and murder accused Sudhir Sangwan said he, along with Sonali and their friend Sukhwinder Singh, "wanted to get high using MDMA drugs" in Goa. He added that after taking MDMA, Phogat's health deteriorated due to an overdose. She vomited, and "her feet were staggering due to intoxication", he added.

374.title: Over 500 property damage cases filed during anti-CAA protests: Delhi Police
374.article_body: The Delhi Police on Wednesday informed the High Court that over 500 cases of property damage were registered during the agitation against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in 2019 and 2020. The police said retired judge Sunil Gaur was appointed the 'claim commissioner' in the related investigations. The court was hearing a petition which sought recovery of the damages.

375.title: Woman straps gold worth ₹15 lakh in sanitary pad, held at B'luru airport
375.article_body: A 26-year-old woman, who was travelling from Thailand to Bengaluru, was held at the Kempegowda International Airport for trying to smuggle gold worth ₹15.4 lakh by strapping it to the sanitary pad she was wearing. The woman was frisked by authorities when she failed to answer a question, following which the gold was found.

376.title: Rats attack road accident victim's dead body kept in mortuary in UP
376.article_body: The body of 21-year-old road accident victim Sumit Gaud, kept in a district hospital mortuary in UP's Gorakhpur, was attacked by rats on Tuesday night. Gaud's family claimed they received his body, which was kept at the mortuary overnight for postmortem, with rat bite marks, including those on his face. Gaud's body was kept in the open, the family claimed.

377.title: Comedian Rohan Joshi criticised for saying 'Good riddance' after Raju Srivastava's death
377.article_body: Comedian Rohan Joshi faced criticism after his remarks on Raju Srivastava's demise. Saying that Srivastava "took every opportunity he ever got to sh*t on newer comics", Joshi wrote in a now-deleted Instagram comment, "Good riddance." "If you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything at all," a person commented, while another comment read, "Shame on the pathetic lowlife."

378.title: Idiot and liar: Musk to US professor who claimed his family owned emerald mine
378.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk on Wednesday called a US professor an "idiot and liar" after he tweeted, "Elon Musk came from a family that owned an emerald mine in Apartheid South Africa." The professor, Robert Reich, also tweeted, "Bill Gates' mom helped Microsoft get a deal with IBM." Through his tweet, Reich called "self-made billionaires" a "myth".

379.title: 'PayCm' posters accusing Bommai of corruption seen across Bengaluru
379.article_body: Posters accusing Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai of corruption were seen pasted across Bengaluru on Wednesday. Titled 'PayCm', the posters featured QR codes which resembled the face of CM Bommai and they bore the tag line 'Scan this QR Code to make the CM PAY for corruption'. Upon scanning, the code redirected to a website called '40% Sarkara'.

380.title: Violation of integrity in its deepest form: Wipro's Premji on staff working for rivals
380.article_body: Rishad Premji, Chairman of IT major Wipro which fired 300 people working directly for one of its competitors, called moonlighting a "complete violation of integrity in its deepest form". He reiterated that there's no space in the company for an employee who also wants to work for a competitor. "I will stand by what I said," Premji said on moonlighting.

381.title: Sanitation workers in B'luru become 'permanent govt employees'
381.article_body: The Karnataka government has decided to give permanent employment status to civic workers in the local bodies, including those under the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike. As many as 11,133 civic workers will be treated as government workers and will get the benefits of public servants. However, the workers' association wants permanent status for all 33,000 sanitation workers across the state.

382.title: Man stabs woman colleague in Thane after she refuses to marry him
382.article_body: A man, Yogesh Kumar, allegedly stabbed a woman colleague in Thane after she refused to marry him, police said on Wednesday. Kumar is absconding, while the 27-year-old woman is undergoing treatment, an official said. The woman, who is already married, suffered injuries in stomach and on the face. She managed to hail an auto-rickshaw and reached a hospital, police added.

383.title: Muslim men accuse MP jail official of forcing them to shave beard
383.article_body: Five Muslim men, lodged in a jail in MP's Rajgarh, have alleged that a jail officer forced them to shave their beards, following which a probe was ordered into the matter. A Congress MLA alleged that these men were abused in the jail, while AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi claimed it was an act of "custodial torture".

384.title: 'Appeasement' politics: Patra on Rahul's pic with hijab-clad girl
384.article_body: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra on Tuesday posted a picture of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi walking hand-in-hand with a hijab-clad girl during the Bharat Jodo Yatra, accusing him of appeasement politics. "When votes are accounted for on the basis of religion…then it's called appeasement," Patra said. Reacting to this, Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said he "didn't even spare the young girl".

385.title: Fintechs need to comply with regulations earlier: Axis Bank CEO
385.article_body: Axis Bank Chief Executive Officer and Managing Director Amitabh Chaudhry said that fintechs have a tendency to do what they want and hope that the regulators won't notice. He stated that has to change and fintechs have to comply with regulations much earlier than they are currently. Further, Chaudhry said that businesses would suffer if they do not pay heed.

386.title: IIT alumni's synthetic speech tech startup Murf AI raises $10 mn
386.article_body: Murf AI, a synthetic speech technology startup, has raised $10 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Matrix Partners India and saw participation from existing investors such as Elevation Capital along with prominent angel investors. Murf was founded in October 2020 by IIT Kharagpur graduates Sneha Roy, Ankur Edkie and Divyanshu Pandey.

387.title: Was judged for attending event after 2 months of giving birth: Neha Dhupia
387.article_body: Neha Dhupia said, as a new mother, she had faced judgements for things as simple as attending an event two months after giving birth. However, she said she has always ignored the judgements and stayed "very unaffected by them". She added that while being a mother is "the most important role" of her life, she goes to work for herself.

388.title: Was praying to see him come out of this: Raju Srivastava's wife
388.article_body: Late comedian Raju Srivastava's wife Shikha Srivastava said she was hopeful about her husband's recovery. She called Raju Srivastava a "true fighter" as he struggled for his life for almost one and a half months. "He fought very hard, I was really hoping and praying to see him come out of this. But, that has not happened," she said.

389.title: 345 kg of heroin worth ₹1,725 cr seized by Delhi Police in Mumbai
389.article_body: The Special Cell of Delhi Police on Wednesday made one of the biggest seizures of heroin from Mumbai and seized heroin worth ₹1,725 crore in the international market, a senior official said. "This seizure indicates how narco terror is impacting our country and international players are using different methodologies to push drugs into our country," said Special CP HGS Dhaliwal.

390.title: Pregnant woman suffers miscarriage after rape by 3 men in Bareilly
390.article_body: A woman suffered a miscarriage after allegedly being raped in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, police said on Wednesday. According to her husband's complaint, the woman, who was three months pregnant, was working on a farm when three men raped her. Police said that the victim has been hospitalised and her condition is critical. One of the accused has been arrested.

391.title: SpiceJet to continue operations at 50% capacity till Oct 29: DGCA
391.article_body: Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Wednesday extended restrictions placed on SpiceJet to operate at 50% capacity till October 29. DGCA noted that the restrictions have been extended "as a matter of abundant caution". Operating capacity shall be increased if SpiceJet showcases it has "sufficient technical support and financial resource to safely" undertake enhanced capacity, DGCA said.

392.title: I lost a friend of 30 years: Ravi Kishan on Raju Srivastava's death
392.article_body: Speaking about Raju Srivastava's death, actor Ravi Kishan said he lost a friend of 30 years. "We both struggled together and we were able to achieve what we had set to achieve," he stated. Ravi revealed that he shared a stage with the late comedian two months ago. Ravi said Raju laid the foundation of Hindi stand-up comedy in India.

393.title: Jignesh Mevani, 14 Congress MLAs suspended from Gujarat Assembly
393.article_body: Gujarat Assembly Speaker Nimaben Acharya on Wednesday suspended Independent MLA Jignesh Mevani and 14 Congress MLAs for a day from the Assembly for unruly behaviour. The legislators demanded a discussion on the issues concerning agitating government employees and farmers. However, when the Speaker refused their demand, the legislators rushed near the well of the House and started shouting slogans.

394.title: ADB cuts India's growth forecast to 7% for FY23
394.article_body: Asian Development Bank (ADB) has slashed the GDP growth forecast for India to 7% for the current financial year. This is now slightly lower than the Reserve Bank of India's estimate of 7.2%. ADB said that inflated prices of commodities, oil and inflation will lead to continuing monetary policy tightening, which would hurt growth in the short run.

395.title: Juul Labs sues US FDA over documents related to e-cigarettes ban
395.article_body: Juul Labs has sued the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) after the latter refused to disclose documents supporting its order banning the sale of e-cigarettes in US on June 23. Juul said, "The public deserves a complete picture of the scientific facts behind one of the agency's most controversial and closely scrutinised decisions in recent years" of banning sales.

396.title: Zepto's 19-yr-old Co-founder youngest Indian with ₹1,000 cr personal wealth
396.article_body: Grocery delivery startup Zepto's 19-year-old Co-founder Kaivalya Vohra is the youngest Indian to have a personal wealth of at least ₹1,000 crore, according to Hurun India Rich List 2022. A majority of Vohra's wealth comes from an over 50% rise in the valuation of Zepto, which he founded with 20-year-old Aadit Palicha. Both Vohra and Palicha are Stanford University dropouts.

397.title: Loan apps on Google Play Store to display link to partner banks: Report
397.article_body: Google has reportedly asked loan disbursal apps on Play Store to mandatorily display a link to their partner banks or non-banking finance companies. Google updated its policies on loan apps on September 5, and the deadline for compliance was September 19. The tech giant said it will begin removing apps "that remain non-compliant with the requirements past the deadline provided".

398.title: Lightman, aide held for stealing equipment worth ₹21 lakh in Mumbai
398.article_body: The Mumbai Police have arrested a 22-year-old lighting technician, Shubham Prajapati, and his 24-year-old associate Nikhil Pawar, for stealing lighting equipment worth ₹21 lakh. According to the complaint, the accused were a part of a unit that was shooting a serial at the Mohammad Ali compound in Malvani, Malad and allegedly fled with a light and stand on May 26.

399.title: NIA court sends 4 suspected PFI members to 14-day custody in Hyd
399.article_body: The four people arrested on Monday by the National Investigation Agency (NIA) with alleged links to the Popular Front of India (PFI) were sent to 14-day judicial custody by a Nampally special court in Hyderabad. The NIA conducted multiple searches at 38 locations and seized cash, mobile phones and laptops. The accused were served notices under section 41 of CrPC.

400.title: 2 Naxals, including a woman, carrying reward of ₹6 lakh surrender in Maha
400.article_body:
Two Naxals, including a woman, carrying a collective reward of ₹6 lakh on their heads surrendered before the police in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli, a senior official said. The Naxals were identified as 26-year-old Anil alias Ramsay Kujur and 30-year-old Roshani Pallo, police said in a release.
Gadchiroli SP Ankit Goyal stated that 51 Naxals have surrendered since 2019.
